availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Stephen Robinson (Clay County, Kentucky, resident, farmer, and laborer)

body.p: Clay County, Kentucky, farmhand. Tennessee native. Married to Sarah Robinson. Father of William Robinson, John Robinson, James Robinson, Thomas Robinson, Catherine Robinson, and Levina Robinson. Resident of Clay County in 1850. Farmhand in Clay County in 1860. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from September 22, 1861, to October 5, 1864. Reported as deserted from Memphis, Shelby County, Tennessee, on December 9, 1862. Reported as returned on October 19, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, Kentucky District, p. 139B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, p. 124.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, Precinct 1, p. 160B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0217.
"Stephen Robinson (1828-1909)," Find A Grave, Memorial 78626567, accessed November 22, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/78626567.
